answers.answer: Hello,I noticed that you posted in the stroke forum and was wondering if you thought or know that a stroke could be a cause for the feeling leaving....can the leg be moved with just thought or does it physically need moved...diabetes and the effects, especially if as you said life long, can be quite aggressive in nature... has the diabetes been under control and by what means, pills or shots and does this person "CHEAT"....when was the last ck up? or blood work? There are times when an intervention would need to take place...for instance....if the toes or foot turn purple or black...GO RIGHT TO E.R....if any trouble with toe nails or bruising that causes a break in the skin....RIGHT TO THE E.R....To be blunt....THIS IS SOMETHING YOU DO NOT WANT TO MESS WITH.....it could mean the loss of an extremidy....I will Pray for you to have a Blessed Day!!!! PLEASE keep us updated...  GOD BLESS!!!!!      loimmarmar

question: A life long diabetic just recently lost all feeling in his left leg. What could cause this and will the feeling come back?
title: diabitic loses sensation in left leg
